items.content:
Golang Engineer for an Open-source Project

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Industry: DevOps, Internet of Things, Software Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Resin.io | No office location

Technologies

docker
go
gnu
linux
embedded-linux

Job description

On being a Golang Engineer at resin.io

Resin.io maintains Balena, an open source Moby-based container engine tailored to IoT devices. We are looking for Golang Engineers with in-depth expertise on container technologies and open source software to innovate in the realm of containers for embedded GNU/Linux devices.

Responsibilities

  • Actively invest back in our own technology, libraries, and frameworks
  • Understand security best practices and strive to apply them in your work
  • Be highly motivated to produce great code
  • Evaluate customer requirements and other inputs to determine the scope and timing of new functionality
  • Lead and maintain the Balena container engine open source project
  • Contribute back to major open source projects such as Docker
  • Research novel approaches to efficiently run and update containers in embedded devices

REQUIREMENTS

Need to have:

  • Desire to make yourself and others more effective. You'd be bothered by an inefficient process
  • Good understanding of software engineering practices and how to apply them
  • Excellent written communication skills, and fluency in English
  • Self-discipline to take on a project and push it to completion without too much management. You also know when to ask for help
  • Experience leading, or contributing to, open source projects
  • Experience with GNU/Linux
  • Experience with Golang
  • In-depth knowledge of Docker internals like namespaces, cgroups, and layers

Nice to have:

  • A sample of your work (URL or attached sample)
  • Contributions to OSS projects (please include a URL)
  • Having worked remotely before
  • Experience with Resin.io as a user
  • Experience with embedded GNU/Linux, anything ranging from personal projects with a Raspberry Pi to commercial or industrial scenarios with custom devices
  • Experience with Node.js
  • Experience with Kubernetes

Make sure to let us know if any of these items apply to you!

Apply now

About Resin.io

Resin.io provides a software platform that helps developers build, deploy and manage the code that runs on connected devices. In short, we make IoT work.

Our technology is open, standards-based and proven in production across a wide range of scenarios from drones, 3D printers, point-of-sale devices, tidal turbines, skyscrapers and more. Our investors include DFJ, Aspect Ventures, GE, and Ericsson.

We come from 15+ countries, and we embrace a remote culture with flexible hours. To us, this means being highly productive while still maintaining a healthy work-life balance. You need to be able to work remotely, and have a dependable internet access available so you can join video calls.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We value knowledge and initiative more than educational and personal backgrounds, age, or location. We maintain a work environment in which team members are treated with respect at all times and in which thoughts and ideas can be shared openly.

We communicate proposals, discuss with others in the team and accept feedback if it makes the result better. We value the ability to learn, which is more important to us than knowledge of specific technologies. We know that learning fast means being outside our comfort zone, which is OK -- we'd rather learn than let our assumptions get in our way.

Benefits

  • Work with extremely talented, distributed team
  • Work remotely
  • Flexible working hours
  • Equipment of your choice
  • Annual company gathering in an international location
  • We send you hardware for side projects!

items.content:
JOB TYPE: Long Term
3+ months

EXPERIENCE: beginner

Chatbot Pack (www.chatbotpack.com) is a growing provider of customized enterprise chatbots & A.I. solutions. We invite you to join the new wave of Artificial Intelligence by applying to our open position of

Business Development Manager (chatbots & A.I services)
Artificial intelligence provides new opportunities in enhancing customer services, improving marketing, inspiring customers and making operations more efficient. Chatbot Pack creates inspiring chat experiences through chat automation, chat robotics and chat staffing.

According to Facebook 51% of consumers say messaging has replaced other communication methods. Therefore, more companies are embracing this shift in consumer habits by offering automated and live services in chat and messaging channels. Workplace chat applications, such as Slack and Microsoft Teams, embrace chatbots, and our tools will make internal operations more efficient.

Main responsibilities for this position are new business development, including identifying potential client, prospecting and approaching business decision makers.

Responsibilities
Identifying potential clients and business opportunities
Approaching and finding decision makers
Demonstrating and convincing clients about the benefits of Chatbot Pack services and automation tools
Expectations
experience in business development or sales from the software or customer service industry
experience in working with distributed remote teams
excellent written and spoken English
familiarity with benefits of instant messaging and chat platforms
understanding of the importance of quality service and good user experience
good persuasion skills through phone, video conferencing and email
knowledge about social selling and sales software tools
understanding and experience with Facebook advertising can be beneficial


Why apply?
Join company culture encouraging creativity and communications
Be a pioneer in the Artificial Intelligence industry
Salary with a stimulating bonus structure
Longterm & full-time position

Practicalities
This is a remote work position. You may also join us in Helsinki or Munich. Job offers for non-EU citizens in Helsinki or Munich are may be contingent upon a EU work permit.

Start date and work hours are negotiable. Work hours shall have some overlap with EET time zone.

items.title: Expert Executive Assistant
items.content:
Expert Executive Assistant at Handy

Remote | Part-time
  • Executive
  • Portland, OR, USA
  • Part-time

Expert Executive Assistant (remote / part-time)

About Handy:

Handy is the leading platform for connecting individuals looking for household services with top-quality, pre-screened independent service professionals. From home cleaning to handyman services, Handy instantly matches thousands of customers every week with top-rated professionals in cities all around the world. With a seamless 60-second booking process, secure payment, and backed by the Handy Happiness Guarantee, Handy is the easiest, most convenient way to book home services.

We are looking to hire an experienced Executive Assistant on a part-time basis, working 20 hour a week covering the evening hours on the East Coast, but the job’s location can be anywhere within the US. You will be providing extended hours coverage’ to a team of Admins in NYC who support key executives at Handy.

Your work will mostly be web and phone based. All training and work will be done wherever you are, but you need to have your computer and the ability to keep it running.

Please read the attached Job Description in its entirety. It is long (apologies), but it will give you a very good sense of what we are looking for and the importance that we are placing on this position. And please do not apply without a customized response to this job post.

About you:

  • Highly communicative: You believe that many issues and challenges do not even arise if you communicate well. You can’t remember the last time of being accused of talking too little.
  • Attention to detail: You love details, if you could you would grow them in your yard, feed them daily and never let even one get away. You believe that no detail is trivial and thrive on feedback to hone skills that allow you to contribute to the company vision.
  • Self-confident: You can communicate professionally and confidently with seasoned business contacts. Heck, you would even impress the president of the United States.
  • Learning: You thrive on advancing your skills and knowledge and have done your share of self-learning. You can adapt quickly based on the needs of the company or Executive and you have a strong commitment to growth through learning new things.
  • Thinking ahead: You enjoy thinking one step ahead for the people you work for, solving needs before they even arise in their minds.
  • Skilled at prioritization: You spend your time exclusively on things that are most important to accomplish for the day; You have the ability to quickly zero in on the critical few’ and put the trivial many’ aside. You commit to understanding the priorities of the company and Executive so that you can make them yours as well.
  • Problem solver: You understand when it’s time to take a step back and evaluate how to best solve a given (expected or unexpected) challenge. No matter what went wrong, you believe there is a solution to it and you are going to find it faster than Indiana Jones.
  • Reliable and Professional: Within just a few short weeks the person you’re working with will build high-level confidence in you. In fact, you wouldn’t be surprised if she/he goes telling their peers that they can leave almost anything to you (and know it’s going to get done). You have an unquestionable personal code of ethics, integrity, diversity, and trust.
  • Writing skills: You might not be the next Hemingway, but you enjoy writing well and get mad every time those silly little things called typos creep up on you.
  • Listening is an art form: You understand the value of listening and love collecting more information than just the words that are being said.
  • Technology is fun: You might not have earned the honors of being called a geek but give you a piece of technology (a service, software or hardware) and you will make it run.

Responsibilities:

Communications Management

  • Receive and transcribe email dictations for contact owner

Task and Time Management

  • Record all tasks assigned and performed in appropriate systems
  • Keep accurate and detailed records of time spent on tasks in appropriate systems
  • Prioritize different types of tasks and meet deadlines
  • Consistently stay up to date on task management and communicate effectively regarding what is most important

Calendar Management

  • Manage Executives time based closely to their priorities. Effectively operate as the gatekeeper of their time to ensure every week most closely represents their most important priorities and focus.
  • Have confidence and sound judgement in pushing back on the Executive when they get distracted from their top priorities.
  • Expertly maintain and update calendar in a fast-paced environment with many competing priorities including fielding all incoming scheduling requests, prioritizing meetings, communicating with all parties, and ensuring that meetings are set up for success – including having accurate locations, contact details, confirmations, and enough time for everyone to arrive in time and debrief if necessary
  • Create follow-up emails to confirm appointments and alert Executive of any conflicts
  • When necessary, book travel and accommodations for the CEO and any other team members who are traveling with the CEO

Meeting Management

  • Create follow-up emails based on information provided by the meeting owner
  • Record information collected from the meeting owner in a contact database
  • Track action items committed to in meetings
  • Add or update calendar items
  • Plan for future interactions that Executive may want to deliver to their network

Management of Contact Database

  • Enter new contact information into appropriate systems
  • Update existing contact information
  • Log value activities performed by contact owner
  • Log Action items in appropriate systems
  • Invite new contacts to proper social media platforms such as LinkedIn
  • Accept LinkedIn invitations, if applicable
  • Merge duplicate contacts
  • Maintain proper system of prioritizing most important relationships and assist with recommending with whom your Executive should interact on any given week

Research management:

  • Perform various internet-based research projects
  • Perform business prospect research

Writing:

  • Create email drafts for the folks you work for based on their unique style/tone
  • Help in producing meaningful and valuable text that can be delivered to Executives network
  • Creation of Value Payload Items (text blurbs on items of value)

Email Management

  • Process emails for Executive and indicate priority of emails in their inbox
  • Draft email responses when possible that Executive can edit and send
  • Scan and extract valuable information communicated via email
  • Alert Executive of any urgent emails that need to be seen or acted on
  • Clean unnecessary noise in the inbox that Executive doesn’t want to see
  • Identify opportunities to produce new interactions based on context gathered via email review

Any other responsibilities that might arise while performing this job

This is important – Please only apply if:

  • You are willing to write a customized response to this job post.
  • You have a proven background of working in a high-velocity environment.
  • You have a proven background of working remotely (if based outside NYC).
  • You have at least 5 years of Administrative Support experience – ideally at the Executive level
  • You can provide at least 2-3 references
  • You have experience or knowledge of the Tech industry (preferred)

Unfortunately, if you do not meet these requirements we will not be able to respond. Congratulations, you have made it to the end of this job posting! That might already qualify you for this job. We can’t wait.

Apply for job

items.content:
Senior Project Manager – Services at NICE

Remote

Sr. Project Manager (Services)
Location: Salt Lake City, UT or Remote (can be worked anywhere in the USA)

The role of the Sr. Project Manager (Services) is to manage all aspects of the project over the entire project life (initiate, plan, execute, control, close) according to strict deadlines and within budget. This includes acquiring resources and coordinating the efforts of team members and third-party contractors or consultants in order to deliver projects according to plan. The Sr. Project Manager will also define the project’s objectives and oversee quality control throughout its life cycle. This position is an expert in system scope and project objectives, supports, develops, and organizes requirement delivery elements, via requirements, documentation, process flows, user stories, as well as identifying capital and resource requirements for major IT projects.

As a Sr. Project Manager (Services) a Typical Day Might Include the Following:

  • Define project scope, goals and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders.
  • Create and manage project plans including scrum meetings according to Agile Development methodologies when applicable.
  • Create cost/benefit analyses in support of corporate projects, while providing methods for management to assess the financial impact of a decision to the bottom line.
  • Work with business units to define and document project scope, requirements, timelines, expectations
  • Effectively communicate project expectations to team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion. Liaise with project stakeholders including executives on an ongoing basis.
  • Manage project priority conflicts and report any issues affecting overall project delivery.
  • Work as a key interface point for business stakeholders, project submitters, and the development team to identify, discuss, and resolve any issues related to functional system delivery.
  • Communicate project status to stake holders and executives.
  • Manage and resolve potential conflicts with other units to management for evaluation.
  • Identify and manage project dependencies and critical path.
  • Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation, and presentations.
  • Determine the frequency and content and deliver status reports from the project team, analyze results, and troubleshoot problem areas.
  • Proactively manage changes in project scope, identify potential crises, and devise contingency plans.
  • Define project success criteria and disseminate them to involved parties throughout project life cycle.
  • Learn NICE inContact’s products and teams to allow for easier understanding in the projects managed.
  • Communicate in an effective and professional way with customers in and outside of NICE inContact including executives
  • Develop processes and procedures for reporting to management the results of implemented projects for evaluation.
  • Can conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
  • Ability to bring complex project to successful completion through political sensitivity.
  • Adept at conducting research into project-related issues and products.
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment is crucial.
  • Identify and analyze risks, devise and implement mitigation method
  • Facilitate large groups to ensure relevant input and successful conflict management
  • Work with multiple vendors
  • Competency
    • Manage large complex projects
    • Multiple work stream
    • Multiple systems
    • Multiple cross functional teams, stakeholders and business units
    • Ability to perform BA tasks and analysis

To Land This Gig You’ll Need:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business Management or related field or equivalent work experience required.
  • MBA strongly encouraged; PMP – PMI – ACP certified
  • 6-9 years direct work experience in project management, including all aspects of process development and execution
  • Demonstrated written and oral communication skills.
  • Strong interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment is crucial.
  • Can conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
  • Ability to motivate others for project execution
  • Excellent conflict management skills and ability to anticipate conflict amongst team members

ABOUT NICE inContact:
NICE inContact makes it easy and affordable for organizations around the globe to provide exceptional customer experiences while meeting key business metrics. NICE inContact provides the world’s No. 1 cloud customer experience platform, NICE inContact CXone, combining best-in-class Omnichannel Routing, Workforce Optimization, Analytics, Automation and Artificial Intelligence on an Open Cloud Foundation. NICE inContact is a part of NICE (Nasdaq: NICE), the worldwide leading provider of both cloud and on-premises enterprise software solutions.

Apply for job

items.title: Head of Global Business Development
items.content:
Who is the MOST inspiring person you know? What have they ACHIEVED that you really admire? Wouldn’t it be great if they would share their success secrets with YOU?

The obvious answer - YES - prompted us to embark on our mission, aiming to improve 10 million lives by 2022. By creating marketing campaigns, launching digital products or coaching our clients, PASSION.IO gives inspiring people the platform they deserve to share their message with the world and impact lives.

We are an international team with the majority of our customers in the US. We’ve grown from nothing to multi-million dollar business in under 2 years… because when you focus on impact, income will follow. We work together to not only make this company successful, but to transform our clients, our customers and ourselves into our best versions.

As we say, *Do it with Passion, or not at all.*

Do you think you’re the right fit?

We are looking for an inspiring, engaged and motivated new member for our team that proactively drives our US expansion and manages projects related to that.

You gained work experiences in high-paced environments and have the vision to change the future of learning.

Your mission will be to drive and grow Passion.io’s multi-million dollar business. We work with inspiring experts with millions of followers. Working on key projects around them will be a relevant part of the job. Hence, past experience with leading teams, project management, sales and strong execution skills would be beneficial. You will work in a cross-functional team to deliver high quality, outstanding work.

*What you'll be working on*
# You will have full P/L responsibility of a multi-million dollar business
# You will further develop the team qualitatively and quantitatively
# You will analyze different verticals in the US and close partnerships
# You manage product launches with the team while consistently sounding out the market to help refine the products while monitoring and optimizing key performance indicators (KPIs)
# You will have ideas for further developing the products and business model, have a clear idea about the offers, and how they transform the market
# You will successfully drive projects through the lifecycle from conception to launch
# Define, structure, develop processes and tools, and show measurable results
# You will work on key projects in marketing, such as CRM, mobile, loyalty, and others to deliver high quality traffic, optimize conversion rates, and improve retention
# You will lead the implementation of the marketing strategy and its roadmap
# You will identify opportunities to further improve the business, streamline operations and share best practices across markets

*What you'll bring to the team*
# Outstanding degree at a top university (likely: MBA, Wi-Ing or similar)
# Desirable: Prolonged stay abroad (> 6 months)
# You have exceptional analytic skills and a strong attention to detail as well as a hands-on mentality
# Preferably gained 2 years professional experience in high-performance environments (strategy consulting, banking, start-up, or similar)
# Proven track record of professional achievements
# Project management: You planned, implemented and controlled major projects, in particular extensive analytical, sales, and marketing work
# Preferably: supported internationalization, set up new business verticals

*What we offer you*
# Steep learning curve: Expect the steepest learning curve you have ever experienced - we are building a playground at passion.io to become the best version of ourselves. Meet and work with successful people worldwide to learn their success secrets.
# Value-based company: Be part of an open, honest, creative, and results-driven environment where your opinion is highly valued. We want to change the globe for the better by providing value to others.
# High-growth environment: You will be part of a strongly growing company with the opportunity to develop into a key contributor with incomparable responsibilities.
# Personal and professional development: You will tackle projects across departments and thereby gain a top-notch tool box to succeed in tackling bigger and bigger challenges.
# Autonomy / entrepreneurial work-style: You will only be measured by the results you produce and are in the driver’s seat, with full flexibility.
# Berlin: You will join our friendly and international team located in the heart of Berlin Mitte.

Web Project Manager - Home based (45k)

Company: Ylopo
Headquarters: Marina del rey
https://www.ylopo.com/
Ylopo is looking for a full-time web project manager (3-5 YOE, U.S based) who’s a great communicator and has extensive experience working with teams to build out high performing websites for small businesses (real estate experience a plus!).  Your role will entail extensive coordination with our clients and both US and off-sure development/design teams.

Our websites are built on top of the Squarespace platform; you'll be working with a talented team of engineers, designers and product managers with deep vertical expertise.  The ideal candidate has an in-depth understanding of content management systems, an excellent eye for design and UX/UI, and exceptional communication skills. This role will be a full-time remote position with rare visits to headquarters in Venice Beach / Santa Monica.

Requirements

  • Web Project Management Experience
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Customer support experience (expect to be on phone calls with clients around 2-3 hours a day)
  • Experience using customer support tools such as Zendesk, Help Scout or something similar
  • Using project management tools like JIRA, Trello,
  • Home office with no distractions and be able to work full-time
  • Ideas, interest, and passion for building beautiful websites

Good to have (bonus) …
  • Real Estate Experience
  • Squarespace Experience
  • Copywriting and Blogging
  • SEO, SEM
  • Facebook Marketing
  • Working with Freelancers in different locations

items.content:
Senior Software Developer - Managed Google Cloud

Company: Rackspace
Remote

Since we are a distributed team we are open to the Rackspace location of your choice, including the option to work from home. Rackspace office locations include San Antonio or Austin, TX and Blacksburg, VA. 

Rackspace is seeking talented developers to help build our Managed GCP business. You will work on a small team working to continuously grow this new business, so we're looking for developers who ship early and often while maintaining healthy engineering discipline. You will write automated tests for everything you build, and we deploy to production several times daily. Because we're distributed, we're remote-friendly -- we collaborate with Slack, Screenhero, and video conferences.

We use React, Redux, and ES6 in our customer-facing web application along with Node for several API services that power specific features. We choose technologies that let us deliver quickly with high quality, and focus on our product's value.

Responsibilities:

  • Write clean, maintainable code using engineering best practices
  • Collaborate with other engineers, product managers, and user experience designers on a daily basis to identify the right technical solutions that achieve product goals
  • Deliver product features for our UI and APIs
  • Continuously broaden and deepen your skill set to solve new technical challenges
  • Mentor and guide less experienced team members to provide technical direction
  • Provide Fanatical Support for our production system by fixing bugs and triaging alerts

The ideal candidate will have the following:

  • 5+ years practical experience in one or more of the following domains:
  • Building web applications with a modern JavaScript framework (Node, React, Angular, Ember, or similar)
  • Building and consuming HTTP APIs in a service-oriented architecture
  • Operating cloud applications in production (handling deployment, monitoring, logging)
  • Demonstrated passion for independent learning
  • Experience working in a team that practices continuous delivery
  • BS in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Apply now

Intern - Social Media Junkie (Outreach & Engagement) at Crowdera

Mumbai, Bengaluru, Menlo Park, Remote · Internship

Probably there are a million ways to build promising career, but nothing beats being part of a compassion driven economy where abundance starts with giving. Crowdera has created world’s first truly free fundraising platform that does not charge any commission or ask for tip from donors. We are changing the way people give and align themselves with the causes and individuals they fund & support. Our continuos evolution will help fundraisers to add sustenance to their organizations, improve their lives, make a lasting impact. What we are set to achieve in next few years will make you fall in love with us. Plus, you get to work with & mentored by silicon valley business leaders and tech gurus with pedigree of eBay, Amazon, Google, Columbia. Ask us and we will give 10 more reasons to work with us.

Applied
Apply to Crowdera
Add a message to Crowdera
Apply

Job Description

Are you hyper networked Social Media Junkie with an ability to engage with millennials? Can you write well? Come work with Crowdera, one of the super cool fast-growing teams spread across multiple geographies.

We are looking for a top notch Social Media Outreach Manager to drive the following:
- Grow and improve our social footprint
- Build and manage communities of selected user groups
- Manage our content calendar and execute on our content strategy
- Write and edit content for social posts and programs
- Drive and optimize social engagement and selling campaigns
- Maximize the impact of our events on web, mobile and social media
- Manage all social ad campaigns across Facebook and other platforms
- Launch, partner and manage our advocacy program for social influencers
- Recommend and employ real-time marketing tactics as applicable
- Ensure on-time and high-quality delivery of our social outputs
- Liaison with marketing vendors to drive projects to completion
- Gather insights through social listening, bringing intelligence back in business

Qualification Criterion:

- Bachelor’s degree and 3-5 years of experience in a similar role
- Strategic mind with the ability to turn concepts into actions
- Exceptional writing skills, a storyteller at heart
- Excellent time management, program management and organizational skills
- Ability to juggle multiple projects and tight deadlines
- Agility and ability to adapt quickly in a fast-growing business
- Positive attitude and a sense of ownership for deliverables

Skills
Social Media, Email Marketing, Social Media Marketing, Content Marketing, Content Writing, Social Media Strategy, Social Media Management, Mailchimp, Content and Creative Writing

What We're Building

Crowdera is a cloud-based fundraising platform and offers a comprehensive fundraising framework for non-profits and social innovators to raise funds without any form of donor dippings. It facilitates all aspects of the online fundraising ecosystem including donation buttons, cross-site donation widgets, websites (CMS), P2P campaigns, donation management, and much more.

Crowdera complements nonprofit's existing fundraising activities and helps them to increase their overall funding & impact by offering a user-friendly, fee-free platform to create visually compelling, viral team fundraising campaigns that help them build meaningful engagement, spread their messages, and expand their donor base.

Crowdera is building a very simple and scalable technology driven business model that would help corporations, fundraisers & Crowdera to be successful at the same time.

FairClaims Intern at FairClaims

Los Angeles, Remote · Internship
FairClaims is the most efficient, most cost effective online dispute resolution platform for enterprise. We work with several leading online marketplaces to resolve their toughest small claims disputes using online video arbitration, mediated chat, smart settlement engine tools and more. And are vc backed (Greycroft Partners, Fika Ventures, Crosslink Capital) with plenty of runway.Read More

FairClaims is the most efficient, most cost effective online dispute resolution platform for enterprise. We work with several leading online marketplaces to resolve their toughest small claims disputes using online video arbitration, mediated chat, smart settlement engine tools and more. And are vc backed (Greycroft Partners, Fika Ventures, Crosslink Capital) with plenty of runway.

Brian Liu, one of the founders of legalzoom is an investor and champion. Along with other top industry angels and great vcs. We have a strong well defined vision, impressive traction and momentum, and are growing fast. Not to mention - we're making the world a better place by resolving more of the world's unresolved disputes. So let's talk about getting you on board.

Applied
Apply to FairClaims
Add a message to FairClaims
Apply

Job Description

Interested in increasing access to justice? Working closely with the management team of a fast-growing, early-stage company? Learning about the landscape surrounding small disputes across the country and around the world? And occasional conference room ping-pong? FairClaims is the place for you!

You'll be involved in all aspects of the company. Not only legal research, but you will also support sales, marketing, customer service and operations efforts. We want this to be a substantive experience so admin work would be limited, but might include some social media management and other duties as assigned.

You will receive training relevant to the start up industry and whichever projects you work on in any/all of the above areas.

We'd love to have someone join us for 10-20 hours a week. Or more. This is an unpaid internship. Law students preferred, but other outstanding candidates will certainly be considered.

Please include your school's requirements for school credit as appropriate.

Major room for growth on all fronts. Could lead to a full-time position for the right candidate.

Please reach out directly to matt@fairclaims.com with any questions!

Head Civil Engineering Course - Research, Training & Development - Part time & Full Time Opportunity at uFaber

Mumbai, Remote · Full Time

uFaber is a well funded edutech startup, founded by serial entrepreneurs from IIT Bombay. Technology has changed almost every aspect of our life but the way we learn is still the same. We know that we have chosen a very complex and difficult problem to solve but if problem is not challenging, whats the fun! We are building a team of super smart and high IQ people who have the capabilities to make products that can create mass impact. If you think there is a need of changing the learning ecosystem and want to be a part of the revolution, lets start the conversation.

Applied
Apply to uFaber
Add a message to uFaber
Apply

Job Description

KRAs

In a growth stage start-up you would be often surprised to know how much and how fast you can work. This is how your initial days might look like

1. You are required to plan, design and develop high quality video based training programs for students spread pan India, specifically for GATE - Civil Engineering.

2. You would be involved in conducting training on - innovative ways of teaching.

3. Developed curriculum and content for the training program

4. Conduct regular assessment of students progression.

5. Mentor trainees and helped them with regular feedbacks on their online teaching.

6. Design and execute interactive sessions.

Who we are looking at

1. Your are excellent in your grasp of adult training and take pride in the depth of your knowledge and understanding

2. You love act of educating others in your skill. You have an uncanny ability to simplify and decipher even the most complex of concepts, for a complete novice.

3. You have high standards of quality and you don- t settle with "just good".

5. You have the fire and desire to do something new and challenging.

6. You get bored doing the same thing and like to explore newer domains.

7. You love what you do have and are brimming with an entrepreneurial spirit

Compensation
₹800K–₹1500K

Regional Director at Advancing Women Executives

San Francisco, San Francisco Bay Area, Silicon Valley, Remote · Full Time
Never underestimate the power of what we're doing, the movement we're creating and the change we're inspiring.Read More

Never underestimate the power of what we're doing, the movement we're creating and the change we're inspiring.

What does it feel like working for a company where clients every day say to you, "Thank you for doing what you do!"?

What does it feel like working for a company where you're impacting positive change in the world?

What does it feel like working for a company where you are constantly learning?

What does it feel like working for a company where you're stimulated intellectually by your peers while, at the same time, laughing and not taking yourself too seriously?

IT FEELS GREAT AND THIS IS WHAT WORKING AT AWE FEELS LIKE EVERY DAY.

Applied
Apply to Advancing Women Executives
Add a message to Advancing Women Executives
Apply

Job Description

What does it feel like working for a company where clients every day say to you, "Thank you for doing what you do!"?
What does it feel like working for a company where you're impacting positive change in the world?
What does it feel like working for a company where you are constantly learning?
What does it feel like working for a company where you're stimulated intellectually by your peers while, at the same time, laughing and not taking yourself too seriously?
It feels great and this is what working at AWE feels like every day.

Advancing Women Executives (AWE) is a start-up with the mission to accelerate the careers of women in business to improve the global economy, by providing VP-level and above corporate executive women the opportunity to build cross-functional and cross-industry relationships in a safe, locally-based environment. AWE membership services include events, training, and executive coaching. AWE currently has memberships in San Francisco, Los Angeles, Silicon Valley, New York and Chicago. AWE is based in Los Angeles, CA, but has staff in all other membership cities.

AWE is seeking a highly qualified Regional Director to join our team to be based in the Bay Area and report to the Founder and CEO. The primary responsibility of this role is to sell AWE services to VP-level and above corporate executive women for the purposes of furthering AWE’s mission and generating business revenue.

Responsibilities:
Prospecting and closing new AWE memberships in San Francisco, Silicon Valley, and Los Angeles;
Network and build relationships with the top influencers in corporate America, private equity, venture capital and service industries;
Lead and develop a team of sales and client relations associates;
Executing a sales methodology with an average sales cycle of 6 weeks or less;
Partner with Associate Director of Member Relations to ensure AWE leaders are active and engaged in membership through a consultative sales approach;
Sales forecasting and new business pipeline management;
Strategize about sales and client relations process and services;
Conduct Training Sessions across California locations;
Host bi-annual events and monthly dinners with AWE leaders.

Qualifications
A successful candidate will possess:

True belief in AWE’s mission to significantly improve the number of women in senior management and on board seats;
The spirit to “Be Bold” and fearless in representing AWE, even during its start-up phase;
Spirit of generosity and service;
Intellectual curiosity and drive to problem solve;
Natural ability to connect with people and to be a connector for people;
6+ years transactional sales experience with success negotiating and closing business;
Exceptional ability to immediately establish one's credibility with senior executives;
Willingness to work outside strict job description parameters, thinking creatively about how to provide the highest level of customer/member service and overall business growth;
Excellent written and oral communication skills;
Strong public speaking skills and experience presenting to large groups;
Great sense of humor;
Excellent meeting facilitation skills; ability to conduct 100% phone-based meetings;
Solid understanding of business concepts and ability to quickly learn content terrain;
Ability to diagnose prospect needs and identify relevant resources;
Ability to meet personal and team weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual financial goals;
Solid understanding of business concepts & dynamics for large national and international corporations;
Superior time management, detail orientation and organization skills;
Bachelor's Degree required, MBA preferred.

AWE is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

What We're Building

Advancing Women Executives (AWE) is a business services start-up with the mission to increase the number of women in executive management and on corporate boards to improve the global economy. AWE provides VP-level and above corporate executives with professional development services including training, executive/career coaching, events, and networking opportunities. AWE currently works with corporate executives at companies based in San Francisco, Silicon Valley, Los Angeles, Chicago and New York. We have over 500 members who come from over 100 Fortune 500 companies, including Salesforce.com, Google, HP, Cisco, Oracle, Getty Images, Allstate, Tiffany & Co., American Express, L’Oreal, Marc Jacobs International, TiVO, Netflix, Disney, VMware, Bank of America, Conde Nast and Pfizer. AWE’s headquarters are in Los Angeles, CA.

What We're Building

Forkable is using AI to conquer the 834B global lunch market. It figures out what you want for lunch before you know it, automatically delivering the best local restaurants to your whole office. A unique copay system makes Forkable accessible to companies with a wide variety of budgets.

By solving the group ordering problem we are able to source from a wide variety of local restaurants with 20x lower delivery costs than normal.

What We're Building

Forkable is using AI to conquer the 834B global lunch market. It figures out what you want for lunch before you know it, automatically delivering the best local restaurants to your whole office. A unique copay system makes Forkable accessible to companies with a wide variety of budgets.

By solving the group ordering problem we are able to source from a wide variety of local restaurants with 20x lower delivery costs than normal.

What We're Building

Forkable is using AI to conquer the 834B global lunch market. It figures out what you want for lunch before you know it, automatically delivering the best local restaurants to your whole office. A unique copay system makes Forkable accessible to companies with a wide variety of budgets.

By solving the group ordering problem we are able to source from a wide variety of local restaurants with 20x lower delivery costs than normal.

Community Manager/Developer Evangelist - USA at HackerEarth

United States, Remote · Contract
HackerEarth provides enterprise software solutions that help organizations in their innovation management and talent assessment endeavors. Read More

HackerEarth provides enterprise software solutions that help organizations in their innovation management and talent assessment endeavors.

HackerEarth Sprint is an innovation management software that helps organizations drive innovation through internal and external talent pools, including HackerEarth’s global community of 2M+ developers. HackerEarth Recruit is a talent assessment platform that helps in efficient technical talent screening allowing organizations to build strong, proficient teams.

Applied
Apply to HackerEarth
Add a message to HackerEarth
Apply

Job Description

Programmers come to HackerEarth to improve their programming skills by solving problems, compete in hackathons & coding challenges and get awesome jobs.

We have quickly grown to become the largest programmer community in Asia and are looking grow aggressively grow overseas. We are looking to hire a Community Manager/Developer Evangelist to help us reach out to programmers in North America. We already have a large number of programmers from Eastern Europe, Southeast Asia and North America and the objective is to accelerate this growth. This is a great opportunity for students who are looking to earn some extra part-time income.

Roles and Responsibilities:

This position is part-time and remote (20 hours/week), hiring globally across major cities.

- Set up a Campus Ambassador program in schools across your region
-Drive adoption of HackerEarth Sprint ­ - a product for hosting & managing hackathons.
-Partner with various programming groups and programming clubs.
-Identify top events/hackathons where HackerEarth should be sponsoring or have some visibility.
-Conduct nationwide hackathons/programming challenges with the help of local partners.

We believe if you are passionate about hackathons and like to interact with people for building communities, you are the perfect fit for this role.

Desired Skills
-Hackathon organizer experience
-Outstanding organizational skills and attention to detail
-Flexible schedule, with availability to work evening and weekends
-Ability to work independently with little supervision

Skills
Community Management, Community Development, Marketing Management, Hackathons
Compensation
$10K–$18K
No Equity

What We're Building

Want to build a career by helping companies grow? You've come to the right place.

HackerEarth delivers best-in-class innovation management and technical recruitment software and helps companies fast-track their growth.

Our innovation management software enables companies to innovate through a data-driven and people-centric process. It simplifies ideation and collaboration and also makes it easy to crowdsource solutions from internal and external audiences.

Our technical recruitment software helps top-tier companies hire top-notch tech talent. With automated tests, it enables them to scale their recruitment process and save a lot of time and costs.

HackerEarth also has a thriving community of 1.7 Mn developers. Large enterprises, government institutions, universities, and nonprofit organizations often turn to our community to solve some of their pressing problems.

So, if you’re looking for an outstanding opportunity in one of the fastest growing startups, apply right away.

items.title: Full Time: SaaSOps Engineering Manager ($100K/yr) at Crossover in Remote work
items.content:
We're running an Online Hiring Tournament on July 28th to hire SaaSOps Engineering Managers (USD $100K/yr).This event will include all testing for the role. Upon grading the deliverables from the event, we will set up qualified candidates with an interview with the hiring manager. This is a 100% remote, full-time role.

The SaaSOps Engineering Manager will be responsible for managing operations of multi-million-dollar revenue per year enterprise SaaS products. As a part of the leadership team, you will be expected to run the engineering operations to ensure the availability, uptime, cost optimization, and overall quality of the product using a revolutionary and radically differentiated processes. You will be the driver of cost and quality optimizations throughout the organization.Along with your managerial skills, you will also leverage your personal technical depth as a former engineer and architect in order to set a personal standard for SaaSOps excellence.If you are eager to gain unprecedented visibility to the top technology companies throughout the globe, employ your technical and managerial skills to oversee cutting-edge SaaS products in a high-intensity environment, and earn $100,000 USD per year while working from virtually anywhere on the planet, this job is for you.

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science (MS or PhD preferred) is absolutely mandatory.
  • 10+ years of hands-on engineering/software development / SaaS Ops / Tech Ops / System (Network) experience leading multiple teams across multiple products and technologies — this is a global leadership role for a seasoned software development leader, not a first executive role for a great software development manager
  • 3+ years of experience of leading cloud/SaaS/tech teams of at least 10 heads
  • Proven experience in building high-performance teams and scalable best engineering practices
  • Commercial experience in SaaS Ops/Tech Ops/Infrastructure Ops/DevOps, networking, performance, security, and operations
  • Excellent understanding of current enterprise software technologies and development practices/tools, including virtualization, source control, build and test automation, code quality automation technologies
  • Experience with high-end enterprise systems deployed in environments of Global 100 corporation complexity
  • Demonstrated success as a problem solver, result-oriented, self-starter
  • Comfortable “working virtually” with teammates and customers around the world. We do a lot of Skype and video conferencing
  • Good proficiency in the English language

We recommend that you attend the tournament instead of applying online, as our tournament process will be much faster.

Cartonomy builds social storefronts and plugins that let your customers share their shopping trip with friends, family, and co-workers.Read More

Cartonomy builds social storefronts and plugins that let your customers share their shopping trip with friends, family, and co-workers.

Cartonomy combines sharing functionality and purchasing capability to create community-inspired social retail experiences for home, work, and life. It helps consumers collaborate with the people they make purchases for and tackle shopping as a group, while giving retailers a customer retention tool that builds loyalty and reduces abandoned carts.

Cartonomy is transforming the experience of shopping online with friends and family with our next generation shopping cart tools.

We are seeking a social media intern for Summer 2016 and possibly beyond to assist in the content creation for our company pages on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn.

The internship is a part-time, paid position, open to students at any U.S. university. The position is based in NYC but remote work arrangements are possible on a per case basis.

mHealth Software Sales Executive (100% Commission) at Delve Health

Minneapolis, Remote · Cofounder

A clinical trial mobile app to provide an echo system for Sponsors to push study material to Investigators and provide direct to Patient remote clinical trial

Applied
Apply to Delve Health
Add a message to Delve Health
Apply

Job Description

Delve Health is a software development “start-up” company headquartered in Minneapolis, MN. We are currently launching a new Clinical Trial collaboration platform (powered by a mobile application) designed to connect the Sponsor, Investigator and Patient called StudyPal.

We need to complete a 90-day demo "blitz" - focused exclusively on Medical Device manufacturers (public/ private) who execute multiple clinical trials per year.

Do you have standing relationships with medical device manufacturers?
Do you have experience selling software solutions to Medical Device manufacturers?
Are you able to schedule a StudyPal "demo" with Clinical Trial Managers, Clinical Operations, VP – Operations or Marketing Managers or related areas?
If you answered "yes" to any of these questions...you could make some serious coin!

Quota - Commission - Bonus:

StudyPal is sold in a license “bundle” costing $24,950 (this is our minimum sale):

Individual sales goal is $200,000 during 90-day demo "blitz." (roughly 8 sales)
$100 per "qualified" StudyPal demo scheduled & executed
10% on first $75k of revenue (tier 1)
15% on second $75k of revenue (tier 2)
20% of all revenue achieved after $150k
plus, an additional $10,000 bonus to any rep exceeding $300k of revenue in 90 days!
This is a ground floor opportunity.

100% commission based contract positions - see structure in posting below
Short-term delivery targets
Team members will operate virtually, with weekly video conference meetings with VP – Sales & CEO
Successful candidates will be well positioned for full-time positions and equity participation
Product Offering: StudyPal is a mobile collaboration software platform designed to improve communication between Clinical Trial participants (Sponsor, Investigators & Patients). The solution is NOT a Clinical Trial Management System (CTMS) or Electric Data Capture (EDC) solution. Value proposition;

Sponsor : Mobile, Collaboration, Analytics, Reduce Study Costs, Auditable, Study Work Flow, Accurate, Multi-language
Investigator : Mobile, Accurate, Fast, Patient Enrollment, Patient Randomization, Easy, Educational, Auditable
Patient : Mobile, Accurate, Fast, Simple, Empowering & Educational
Training and Preparation: Delve Health will provide you with a web demo of the StudyPal platform and answer any questions so you will be able to make a proper pitch. We will also provide ongoing support, and closing resources to ensure the offering has been properly framed for the need.

Primary Function: Operate as part of a team for marketing, promoting and profitably selling products and services to new customers.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Seeks out prospective customers/business opportunities with new customers.
Work as a sales team member to develop a marketing strategy and plan.
Collaboratively develop and maintain a sales forecast to help analyze market conditions for maximum productivity and sales growth.
Implement individual sales plan to support sales and profitability goals.
Generate profitable sales orders.
Work remotely while maintaining a high degree of collaboration.
Makes personal sales calls.
Follow-up on all generated quotations to assure that the customer is being serviced and to document the outcome of the proposed solution.
Report competitive conditions and feedback from customers to management.
Execute sales efforts in an ethical and professional manner, assuring a favorable impression of self and the company.
Maintains a professional/working image
Qualifications:

Proven record of business development and sales within Medical Device verticle.
Bachelor's degree in business with an emphasis in sales and marketing; or closely related field with three years of relevant sales and industry experience; or equivalent combined education and on the job experience.
Commitment to and demonstration of high ethical standards governing professional behavior and interactions.
Technical fluency on social media platforms and basic CRM, as well as standard email and MS Office products.
Demonstrated time management and organizational skills.
Demonstrated ability to communicate clearly and concisely in written and verbal formats, including sales presentations
Demonstrated capability to develop strong interpersonal working relationships and work in a team environment.
Strong customer service orientation.
Read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, etc.
Requirements:

Must have a PC/ laptop with stable and functional internet.
Home office area, with full high-speed access and ability to run web cons and phone meetings professionally and reliably
Role is BYOD. Must have a functioning telephone.

Skills
Sales, Medical Devices, Life Sciences
Compensation
$120K–$200K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

What We're Building

Researchers, Scientists and Doctors are always looking for ways to identify better diagnoses andtreatment options and respond to why, what and how questions.

There are over 9 million researchers and scientists across universities, pharma and healthcare institutions alone that are constantly conducting literature reviews as part of their quest to answer those questions. Those scientists have to login to various websites and conduct multiple searches to obtain the answers. Recently, research has shown that only about 5% of them have the skill to get to their intended results within 3 searches or less. The rest have to invest considerable time and effort and often end up with results that are either bloated or inaccurate. With over 35 million publications, over 220,000 clinical trials and millions of adverse events it becomes a very manual and time consuming process to conduct a comprehensive literature review.

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Head Of Engineering


Snowplow Analytics


Head of Engineering

Ideally located in London, Berlin or Amsterdam (open to other locations)

At Snowplow, we are on a mission to empower people to differentiate with data. We provide both the technology and services to enable our customers to not only take control of their data, but allow them to do amazing things with that control.

As part of that effort, we're changing the way that people do digital analytics by moving companies away from a one-size-fits-all mindset and enabling them to collect and own their data themselves.

The Opportunity

Following rapid company growth over the last 12 months, we’re now looking for a Head of Engineering to join us and lead, guide & support our fully-remote engineering team through the next phases of growth. Though the team is still relatively small, they’re already dealing with hugely complex challenges spanning across product, data engineering, cloud architecture, automation and much more.

The role will comprise of 3 key parts:



* People Management





We have a talented & diverse team of engineers - it will be your job to coach & mentor them, to ensure their personal development is being looked after and to continue to hire people that are not only strong technically, but also closely align with our company culture (wherever they may be located).  



* Growth





Snowplow’s growth plans are ambitious and a large part of the role will be focused around scaling the technology and coming up with creative ways to overcome obstacles. Our Head of Engineering should be at the forefront of technical innovation, able to prioritise with ease and confident making difficult decisions. We’re looking for someone forward-thinking, who is able to deliver great results now, while also looking ahead at the next hurdle.



* Technical Excellence





We want to build the possible product and in order to do so, we require technical expertise. We expect our Head of Engineering to do things right and to instil this in the entire team. Best practices, consistent performance and outstanding delivery.

The role is unique, the challenges are complex and the team is diverse. We’re looking for someone who takes all of this and is excited about solving those challenges, and continuing to build a high-performing engineering team at Snowplow.

Things you’ll be doing:


* Own and operate the Agile processes that we are running

* Conduct regular 1:1s, champion personal development and hire awesome talent

* Focus on automation and scaling our current technology

* Hold the team to high standards and deliver outstanding results

* Work closely with Product & Engineering to shape how our product is being developed, delivered & refined

* Improve efficiency & stability

* Lead with authority, positivity and by example




We’d love to hear from you if:


* You have experience of working in an engineering management or leadership position looking after multiple squads

* You have worked with remote teams and are comfortable heading up a geographically distributed team

* You have a background in one or more of the following:



* Building SaaS & Web Apps

* Data Engineering

* Microservices or Cloud Architecture







* You exude technical leadership & authoritativeness while also fostering an environment of openness & respect

* The idea of growing an engineering team in a fast-paced startup excites you

* You have experience scaling technology

* You inspire and motivate those around you

* You’re confident making difficult decisions and navigating change




What you’ll get in return:


* A competitive package, including share options

* 25 days of holiday a year (plus bank holidays)

* Freedom to work wherever suits you best

* Two fantastic company Away-Weeks in a different European city each year (the last one was in Milan in May 2018)

* Work alongside a supportive and talented team

* Grow and develop in a fast-moving, collaborative organisation

* MacBook Pro

* Enjoy fun events in and around London organised by our Cultural Work Committee

* Improve your existing skills or mentor more junior developers in our Software Development Guild

* Convenient location in central London (Shoreditch)

* Continuous supply of Pact coffee


See more jobs at Snowplow Analytics

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced sales leader to effectively drive IntellaSphere’s sales activities in order to maximize customer/subscriber acquisition. We’re looking for a highly motivated, hands-on sales rock star, who has broad experience growing sales with B2B SaaS-based software and/or a Digital Marketing Agency (preferably experience with both).

Our business is ready to take flight – so we are looking for someone who moves fast, is nimble, comfortable with digital marketing solutions, and has a strong desire to drive revenue and sales to the next level and be part of a winning team.

Job description

• Quickly learn, understand and be able to pitch IntellaSphere’s Integrated Marketing System.
• Create, communicate and execute on an effective sales approach and sales plan.
• Close sales of our full service marketing offering and help drive trial signups of our DIY SaaS-service offering.
• Manage all steps of the sales process / sales pipeline, from lead generation to nurturing to closing.
• Sell consultatively, assessing the prospective client’s needs and tapping into how our a multi-channel product suite can help them quickly grow their business.
• Conceptualize breakthrough sales strategies and programs that drive sales, as well as differentiate and advantage IntellaSphere.
• Serve as an sales ambassador / evangelist for the company. Instill confidence in and loyalty to our brand.
• Determine and optimize cost effective sales initiatives / programs.
• Build or better yet, leverage existing relationships at all levels, including small-to-mid-size businesses, digital marketers, marketing agencies and key industry influencers

items.content:
About our company:
Agenda.Video is a London-based start up developing unique capability to produce high quality videos for internet, very fast and at a low cost.
“Video is a megatrend” (Mark Zuckerberg) and Agenda.Video aims to become a preeminent producer of effective promo videos for many B2C businesses marketing themselves on the internet. We operate a network of trained video editors - “Uber for video”.

Some of the things we’d like you to do:
- Find marketing decision makers in real estate agents
- Explain to them why they need to market their properties with videos, and convince them to regularly order these videos from Agenda.Video
- Understand current and future marketing needs of the real estate agents and propose how to improve Agenda.Video offering
- Build strong relationships with other key members of the Agenda.Video team and work together on creating the winning proposition and digital marketing plan

A bit about yourself:
- Successful experience (2-5 years) in sales or business development with an established estate agent
- Open-minded, out-of-the-box thinking
- Strong motivation and initiative
- Ability to network, build relationships with potential clients and close sales


What you can expect from Agenda.Video:
- Pay: c. £ 20.000 - 22.000 per year base + a good commission on sales
- Fully remote working
- Flexible schedule
- Exciting international colleagues and clients
- European corporate culture based on values and feedback
- Opportunity to participate and grow with a great startup that will change the industry

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
NO AGENCIES PLEASE****

Splento is an Amazon-like hybrid marketplace that controls the entire visual content creation, curation and distribution process from start to finish: from how you make your booking, to customer support, to photo editing, delivery, storage and sharing.

This is an opportunity for full-time Sales Operational Executive to help grow and build our sales team. You’ll be working in a fast-paced environment, as part of a small sales team, reporting to Head of Growth. The role is varied, with plenty of opportunities to learn.

Due to continued expansion, we are now looking to further grow tour UK team and continue to increase our portfolio of clients. In order to do this they need a proactive and knowledgeable Sales Operational Manager who is a numbers geek, very attentive to details, organized and has an analytical mind.

The successful candidate will be responsible for:

- Developing sales processes
- Support the other functions to drive key commercial drivers
- Mapping and creating an action plan to reduce risk from a sales perspective
- Supporting on the management of bespoke business projects
- Developing systems both online and through the CRM.
- Experience in the events industry is a huge +
- Experience with Hubspot is a huge +, but training will be provided
- Excellent command of the English language
- Strong written and verbal communication skills
- Time management skills and the ability to meet deadlines
- Someone interested in working in a fast-paced startup environment
- Eligible to work in the UK

Perks include:
– Free coffee and tea when in the office :)
– Flexible working hours and working remotely/from home is fine, but we prefer to have at least 4 days in the office.


JOB DESCRIPTION:


Strategic:
Communicate customer feedback to technical, marketing and management teams in order to develop processes for better serving customers.
Prepare templates for routine customer correspondence for future optimisation
Assist in training peers on improving sales skills
Develop and maintain in-depth product knowledge
Develop innovative and creative ideas for increasing sales
Follow communication procedures, guidelines and policies


Tactical:
Actively engage existing customers through calls, networking and social media
Maintain weekly reports of sales and feedback, so as to develop sales analytics and trends
Keep records of customer interactions on HubSpot
Prepare sales presentations and proposals for customers
Organising sales meetings

Job Description

We are looking for an enthusiastic and detail oriented intern, who desires to learn from a growing, fast paced early start-up. This is a great opportunity for anyone who wants to be a part of a growing company and contribute to the art community. Please note this is a remote opportunity and ideal for anyone wanting to build their resume in the arts and publishing industry.

Art Zealous is an online arts platform that is changing the way young people absorb art news and stories by delivering content in a light, digestible style. Art Zealous aims to deliver content about emerging artists, latest exhibitions in LA, MIAMI, and NYC, museum galas and what to wear to them.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
-Creating and uploading editorial content related to the art world
-Maintain and update art event listings

-Working knowledge of basic HTML, MS Office Suite & social media apps (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest)
-Possess excellent written and verbal communication
-Good interpersonal skills
-Must be a self-starter, reliable, enthusiastic and quick learner.

This is a non-paid internship.
