items.title: Director of Operations
items.content:
Director of Operations

Company: Zoomforth

See here for a full description, and application instructions: https://share.zoomforth.com/director-of-ops

Join an early-stage, profitable company serving some of the world's top brands. Work directly with our CEO and help us optimize processes and manage priorities as we scale.

Zoomforth's design software helps customers gather and arrange content into beautiful web pages online. It's like Squarespace but specifically for professional communications.

We work with some of the world's top professional services companies and agencies, and we're looking for someone to help us manage priorities and processes as we scale.

We're a remote company (with an office in SF), with about 20 talented, kind and committed individuals working across the country and world.

We're quickly gaining traction supporting companies as they adapt their communications to a digital world. And after five years, we're now profitable, and have a huge opportunity to be a go-to solution for web-native communications in the modern enterprise. Our opportunity to scale, however, will be either advanced or constrained by how we optimize the time of our current team, prioritize, and improve our processes to meet customer demand.

You'll be working across the entire company, but primarily with our CEO. This means that some decisions that have historically been made by the CEO will be yours to make. It's a tremendous opportunity for anyone who wants to learn & grow, and has the opportunity to transition into a COO role.

RESPONSIBILITIES
You’ll be doing something different every week. Your job is to determine the most important operational barriers to growth and solve for it in any given week or month. You’ll do some measure of all of the areas below:

Operations
- Design and run a hiring pipeline
- Develop communications systems and practices to strengthen a remote culture and keep the team engaged
- Support the CEO in administrative tasks and scheduling
- Help design, organize, and manage bi-annual team retreats

Project Management
- Coordinate with our design team and manage client design requests to ensure design projects are swiftly completed.

Business Development
- Lead outreach to prospective partners to begin developing a network of parter companies.

Data and Reporting
- Manage reporting across sales, customer success, and product. For example, you'll determine the most efficient way to consistently surface sales metrics to the team, ensuring that we remain focused and that we learn from our data. 

Other Sample Projects
- Research GDPR requirements & develop strategy for compliance
- Support the bringing together of a global advisory board
How to apply:
See here for a full description, and application instructions: share.zoomforth.com/director-of-ops

items.title: Development Manager
items.content:
Development Manager


Finfolio


FinFolio is simplifying wealth management for professional financial advisers. Can you switch rapidy between talking high-level architecture and putting out the latest fire? This is for you! :-) We need somebody to lead our development team, which is a mix of onsite and remote developers. We recently completed a 2-year pivot from a desktop app to our current modern web app. 

Our pivot worked and business is booming. Part of your responsibilities are interacting with the management team, and clients and prospects. We're seeking someone who wants to work in financial software development; a background in finance would be a plus but is not required. We should see some nice growth over the next few years.

This is a hands-on job. You will write some code, but most of your time is spent helping guide the product direction and keeping the team focused on the right things. Early stage startup atmosphere, lots of fun but can be chaotic with hard work. (12/12 on the Joel test)

We are open to a remote role although prefer a local candidate for this position. FinFolio is roughly 50% remote workers but this position requires a high level of interaction with the CEO and other senior managers.

See more jobs at Finfolio

items.title: Account Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
*Role Summary*

We have an exciting opportunity for a sales professional to join our team. Your role will be working as a valuable member of our sales team managing relationships with our amazing partner accounting firms.

We're growing at an incredible rate and generating huge growth in the accounting channel. This is a perfect time to join Chaser and make an instant impact and contribution to the company's success.

Chaser Account Managers are at the heart of our sales and customer service offering. Taking a consultative approach to form strong relationships with our accounting partners, assisting and guiding them with cloud strategy.

As cloud accounting adoption keeps increasing within accounting firms, you will have the unique position to help support and increase their client portfolio by adopting Chaser into their firms. You can truly help them become more efficient, add real value to their clients and help them become that go digital accounting firm they strive to become.

You'll be reporting directly to the Head of Partner Channel Sales. Our head office is located in Moorgate London; however, we do offer remote working for the right candidate.

*As a person you:*

* Have highly developed communication skills and a positive demeanour
* Are consultative, process driven and persistent, with excellent professional written and verbal communication skills
* Have a proven track record in sales / account management within the B2B space (SaaS or Fintech would be great but not a requirement)
* Hard working but like to have fun and come to work with a smile on your face
* You will be extremely ambitious
* You will be someone who thrives in a high speed environment
* Digitally proficient, you will be excited to build an understanding of how best to use Chaser as a product. This will be essential for your success in the role

*What your role will consist of*

* Building a deep understanding of accounting and bookkeeping firms
* Acting as a trusted advisor to our accounting and bookkeeping partners and supporting change management in their firms
* Educating partners to help maximise growth
* Managing and respond to incoming partner enquiries
* Monitoring all existing and prospective partners progress through the sales funnel
* Maintaining and update the CRM system of all partners staff and contact details, alongside adding new partner enquiries
* Creating and running webinars
* Providing both online and onsite demos of Chaser

*Why you'll love Chaser*

At Chaser we value our people, we want them to enjoy the job they do and provide opportunities to love and grow their career. An exciting growing company we attract people who want to help us have a positive impact by helping our partner and their clients thrive and be successful. Our passionate, innovative Chaser team strive every day to make a meaningful impact. At Chaser, we truly value the input of every single member of the team. If successful, you'll be joining a sharp, welcoming group of people who will help you learn new skills and develop as an individual.

*Benefits*

* Competitive salary
* Share options
* Company pension scheme
* 25 days holiday
* Flexible working hours

If you're looking for a role that is exciting, challenging and diverse in which you can form lasting business and personal relationships, apply for the Chaser Account Manager position today.

*How to apply*

In applying please answer the following questions:

# Why have you applied for this role?
# Talk us through your most recent/relevant role and your sales performance to date
# What is your proudest professional achievement and why? - ( Max 200 words)
# Are you eligible to work in the UK?

items.title: Head of Customer Success
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
*Role Summary*

We’re looking for a passionate, customer-focused leader who can build and own responsibility for our Success and Support processes. Our primary route to market is through accounting and bookkeeping firms. You will be responsible for the delivery of Partner Success to those partner accounting and bookkeeping firms to ensure they make the most out of the block licences we sell to them. You will also be responsible for the delivery of Customer Success to new direct trialists to ensure maximum conversion from free trial. You will own responsibility for both ongoing retention and expansion MRR.

We are growing at a fantastic rate. Success and support are absolutely integral to our growth. This is an incredible opportunity for someone talented and ambitious to make a huge impact.

You'll be reporting directly to the CEO. Our head office is located in Moorgate London. Over half our team work remotely and we do offer remote working for the right candidate.

*Your Role Will Consist Of*

* Recruiting and managing a high performing success team. At the outset, this will be a team of two so you will still need to be very actively involved in delivery
* Building a deep understanding of accounting and bookkeeping firms. You will need to develop a deep empathy that can enable us to work with them to successfully introduce Chaser to their clients
* Crafting, delivering and refining training programmes for accounting and bookkeeping firm staff. This training will need to provide them with a detailed understanding of how Chaser as a product works. It will also need to equip them to identify opportunities and successfully sell and market Chaser to clients who could benefit from it
* Leading ongoing partner and customer account management to both avoid churn and maximise upsell opportunities for growth in their use of Chaser
* Delivering demonstrations of Chaser
* Management of all educational resources about Chaser, including inter alia our help centre and educational videos
* Ensuring partners and customers are aware of all new developments to the product and enabled to make the most out of them
* Creating and running webinars about Chaser
* Crafting, delivering and refining our Customer Success outreach and training process to new direct trialists so as to maximise trial conversion and retention
* Ensure that all customer and partner support is prompt and comprehensive. We pride ourselves on the quality of our support as a company
* Work closely with Sales, Marketing, Product and Engineering in carrying out these responsibilities; relaying feedback and insights as the voice of our partner and customer to shape our ongoing product roadmap
* Attending and representing Chaser at events

*About You*

* You will have a minimum of 3 years sales, success or account management experience. Experience of working in SaaS, with accounting firms or in credit control is a bonus
* You will have a deep passion for helping our customers and partners succeed
* You will be a proactive self-starter who is comfortable taking the initiative and solving problems autonomously
* You will be positive with an ability to engender the energy and excitement in partners and customers to use Chaser
* You will be extremely ambitious
* You will love learning (fast!). You will be comfortable (well, as comfortable as it’s possible to be!) learning through trial and error
* You will have strong commercial and business acumen with an instinct for opportunity
* You don’t need to be an amateur netless tightrope walker, but you will be comfortable with the need to take risks in the role
* You will have excellent written communication skills
* You will have excellent spoken communication skills, both in person and over the phone. You will need to explain what are often complex technical matters in simple terms
* You will have strong time management and prioritisation skills. There will be lots of balls to juggle in this role
* You will be someone who thrives working in a high speed environment
* You will be excited about working as part of a small, tight-knit team
* Digitally proficient, you will be excited to build an excellent understanding of how to best use Chaser as a product. Curiosity about how and why our product works will serve you well in this role

*Benefits*

* Competitive salary
* Share options
* Company pension scheme
* 25 days holiday
* Flexible working hours

*How to apply*

In applying please answer the following questions:

# Why have you applied for this role? (Max 100 words)
# What is your proudest professional achievement and why? ( Max 200 words)
# What is a company or product that you think has excellent educational resources and/or support materials; and what makes them so good?
# What is the one resource (be that video, written, audio or any other medium) that you would recommend everyone in your Success team consume to help them do their jobs better; and why are you recommending it?
# Are you eligible to work in the UK?

items.title: CET Sales Support and Special Projects
items.content:
Job Requirements

This is a full-time remote sales position for someone with existing customer service experience, who loves customer service work, and would like to add involvement in related sales projects such as partner relations, licensing, and documentation.

We are looking for someone who is willing to usually work 9:00am-6:00pm CET.

The job requires written and spoken fluency in English (any other language skills are a plus).

About Us

We are a small software company with team members working all over the world. Our goal is to help rid the world of bad software - not a small task! We believe that providing best-in-class customer support is just as important as the software and services we provide. Our support staff is the face of our organization - the manifestation of our ideals and love for our users.

We have grown slowly and remained agile for over ten years now, and that's something we really treasure. When you join our team, you join our circle of friends.

About You

Here are a few things we believe are required to do the CET Sales Support & Special Projects job well.

You are Accurate and Organized
To be successful in this role you'll need to be focused and detail-oriented and good at self-management. We are looking for someone who in addition to dealing with daily sales support tickets, will bring skills in Project Management. You know how to take a new task, research it, figure out the steps required to deliver the work on time, and communicate to others about it.

You have Empathy
We believe this is the single most important attribute of an awesome sales support person. Being able to jump into a user's shoes (and walk around a bit) gives you the best perspective to help them. Our company also strives to focus on empathy in our interactions with each other, as well as with our partners and vendors. You know how to balance the importance of an efficient process and the goals of the company while still caring for the needs of an individual person.

You Love Helping People
We're looking for someone who genuinely likes interacting with people: meeting them, hearing their stories, helping them with their problems, and treating each new customer interaction like the beginning of a long-term friendship.

You Are Tech Savvy
Not only will you be helping customers decide what version of Balsamiq software is best for them, we also work in a remote "virtual" work environment. That means we use a lot of different software to keep our organization moving. You don't need to have a computer science degree, but being comfortable learning and using new software to communicate, track projects, and organize information is a must.

The Work

You should take the time to read our what it's like to work at Balsamiq page. It will help you decide if we are a good match for you.

The Sales Support work for this position is currently done by our colleague Anna, but due to recent growth in our company, we've decided to split the work into two positions. The second portion of the work is other sales related projects where our team could use assistance.

You'll be a member of the Sales Team (also known as the Wow! Division) and work collaboratively with the Tech Support Team (Customer Champions) spread between the US and Europe.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Sales Support in CET 50%
    • phone and email support for an average of 20 customers a day
    • processing orders, refunds, general sales inquiries, lost license keys, basic installation/registration issues, etc
    • keeping up to date on basic changes in our software: new features, new prices, and new purchasing processes
    • help advise customers to pick the best and most cost effective way to purchase our product for their situation
    • help the sales team watch for trends in problems or requests from our customers, to help improve our software and systems
  • Collaboration and Management of Various Sales-Related Projects 50%
    • The Sales Support team's main focus is helping customers. The nature of the team is not project-heavy, but there are certain areas that we would like to develop, and that's exactly where we could use your help.
    • Some of these areas include:
      • strengthening and improving relations with Software Resellers and Partners
      • continued development and enhancement of sales processes
      • continued enhancement of legal and software licensing best practices
      • general project management when it comes to recognizing and taking action when there is a need for improvement

items.title: Senior QA Engineer/Manager
items.content:
OpenPlay is a digital platform operating in the UK, Ireland, UAE, Canada, Australia and Singapore that connects people to sports facilities and activities. It offers a search engine and a ‘nudge tool’ with curation based around user preferences, with quick easy online booking.

The core product is a comprehensive online booking system for venues and activity providers used to run all aspects of their business- see more at http://openplay.net

We are based in an amazing office in Clerkenwell, Central London with an informal, hard-working and kind team culture. The office is full of other innovative startups and there’s a real buzz in our working space.

The successful senior QA will be the first point of contact for all testing requirements. You will help shape our QA roadmap from seeing up Jira workflows/processes to managing junior QAs in the team.

Key Skills:

- Have worked in a structured environment with standard QA Procedures and Processes.

- Have experience of working in an environment encompassing the full life cycle of product development from defining and writing the technical specification through to release.

- Good working knowledge and experience in JIRA and related tools.

- Be capable of prioritising own workload and potentially others in a high pressured and time constrained environment.

- Have the ability to demonstrate skills in troubleshooting and 'thinking on your feet'.

- Experience testing large web applications and developing automation frameworks

- Experience managing one or more junior QAs

Location

The role would mainly be based from our offices in Clerkenwell but we do have flexibility for remote/ home working – we are a remote focused company so slack/Skype/trello etc are used in the majority of day to day interactions

items.title: Engineering Manager Studio
items.content:
Engineering Manager Studio


Invisionapp


You are someone who loves building high performing teams. You believe that the foundations of a really good team are a clear vision, engaged and talented engineers, just enough process, fast and effective decision-making, and excellent communication.  You’re never satisfied and are always looking for ways to make things better and to deliver faster with higher reliability. You care deeply about the work that you do and the people who are doing it. You practice the leader-leader model. You love building great products and working with awesome people.


At InVision, we are creating the world's leading product design experiences through powerful design and prototyping tools.  We are building InVision Studio to be the world’s most powerful screen design tool. But in many ways, that’s just the beginning.  We intend for Studio to be a platform upon which a massive ecosystem of creative people can solve problems we never even imagined. Through this platform we will be enabling a powerful ecosystem of plugins and applications that enable designers and more to achieve their goals.  As an Engineering Manager on the Studio Marketplace, your team will build the UI and infrastructure that allows developers and partners to share their unique additions to the Studio ecosystem.


There are a number of reasons you really want to be an Engineering Manager on this team.  You will have the opportunity to work with a super talented, engaged engineers who love what they do.  You will work with an experienced leadership team that has successfully grown and mentored managers. You’ll be part of a peer group that is supportive and always learning.


As an Engineering Manager, you will:


* Be accountable for your team’s delivery and execution on projects and operation of services.

* Lead and grow the engineers on your team through coaching and mentoring, regular reviews, and one-on-ones.

* Manage projects through effective planning, communication of status, and coordination of activities within your team and across teams.

* Continuously improve your team’s processes.





A great candidate is someone who is:


* Experienced in mentoring and coaching engineers.

* Experienced in delivering complex projects quickly and with a focus on quality and reliability.

* Process-oriented but hates bureaucracy. Experienced with Agile and/or Lean.

* Good at getting things done with minimal oversight while maintaining good information flow.

* Experienced hiring good engineers who add to the strengths of the team.

* Balances good strategic vision with tactical execution.





If this sounds like you, please let us know in a cover letter why you think this is a perfect fit for you.


Get to Know Us:
InVision is the Digital Product Design platform used to make the world’s best customer experiences. We provide design tools and educational resources for teams to navigate every stage of the product design process, from ideation to development.

Today, more than 3.5 million people use InVision to create a repeatable and streamlined design workflow; rapidly design and prototype products before writing code, and collaborate across their entire organization. That includes more than 80 percent of the Fortune 100, and organizations like Airbnb, Amazon, HBO, Netflix, Slack, Starbucks and Uber, who are now able to design better products, faster.

InVision is a fully distributed company with employees in 25 countries around the world. The company has raised more than $235 million in funding from leading investors including Accel, ICONIQ, FirstMark, Tiger Global, Battery Ventures, and Spark Capital. Visit us at InVisionApp.com and InVisionApp.com/blog.

See more jobs at Invisionapp

items.title: Full Time: Project Manager with Product Experience at The Tor Project, Inc. (Recruiting) in Seattle, WA or Remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
The Tor Project, Inc., a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization advancing human rights and freedoms by creating and deploying free and open source anonymity and privacy technologies, is seeking a Project Manager with product experience to help coordinate our Tor Browser (desktop and mobile), UX, and Community teams.

The ideal candidate has experience leading an open source project. Tor is developed and maintained collaboratively through the contributions of a diverse, global community. We work hard to choose communications tools that encourage participation, where every contributor is heard and respected. The person in this job must be a team player with excellent communication skills.

The primary focus of our Product PM is to help the Browser, UX, and Community teams succeed by fulfilling their contractual obligations and meeting their roadmap goals. This person will be responsible for ensuring a productive, healthy work environment so all team members are able to contribute effectively and to the best of their abilities. All teams are distributed globally across multiple time zones, so the ability to organize and communicate via chats, email, etc., is crucial. This person will also be the link between the teams, volunteers, and sponsors (funders), and thus must have strong organizational skills and the ability to communicate in writing to diverse audiences.

You will be helping teams roadmap, identify projects for grant proposals, manage the execution of projects, and write progress reports for sponsors. This is where your experience with product comes in -- your product eye should help facilitate discussions between all stakeholders participating in product decisions at Tor.

This position will work closely with other team leads and project managers. This position reports directly to the Executive Director.

Responsibilities:

  • Roadmap: provide advice to teams where needed and point them in the right direction; help them understand what is expected of them
  • Coordinate the transfer of information to and between the teams, sponsors, and greater Tor community
  • Organize team meetings, help your teams plan their roadmaps, and show the teams how to improve their processes
  • Work with other project managers to coordinate contingencies within other teams’ roadmaps
  • Work on grant proposals with the Tor Project’s Fundraising Director and Grant Writer by providing them with your teams’ ideas for projects and the personnel needed for execution
  • Manage risks and issues that might occur while executing a project
  • Oversee roadmap execution and monitor each team’s progress on their respective projects

Qualifications:

  • Solid UX background, with understanding of or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies
  • Super organized
  • Knowledge of how to build great processes, no matter what tools the teams are using
  • Great facilitator
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to communicate with many different audiences
  • Experience managing a team is a huge plus
  • Knowledge of and experience with software development life-cycle process
  • Experience with Free and Open Source Software culture
  • Comfortable with transparency
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • General knowledge of internet technologies and security tools
  • Prior experience working on U.S. government grants and contracts a plus!
  • Willingness to travel internationally at least twice a year

The Tor Project's workforce is smart and committed. Experience working with open source communities and/or a dedication to internet freedom are added pluses. The Tor Project currently has a paid and contract staff of around 35 developers and operational support staff, plus many thousands of volunteers who contribute to our work. The ideal candidate will be energetic, unflappable and flexible, and will thrive in a highly-technical collaborative environment.

This is a full-time, hands-on position, which can be done remotely or in our office in Seattle, WA. Flexible salary, depending on experience. The Tor Project has a competitive benefits package, including a generous PTO policy; 14 paid holidays per year (including the week between Christmas and New Year's, when the office is closed); health, vision, dental, disability, and life insurance paid in full for employee; flexible work schedule; and occasional travel opportunities.

To apply, send a cover letter and your resume to hr at torproject dot org with the subject "Project Manager - Product." Tell us why you think you're the right person for this job and why you want to work at Tor Project. No phone calls please!

The Tor Project, Inc., is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer.

items.title: Full Time: Project Manager for Tor Network Projects at The Tor Project, Inc. (Recruiting) in Seattle, WA or Remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
The Tor Project, Inc., a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization advancing human rights and freedoms by creating and deploying free and open source anonymity and privacy technologies, is seeking a Project Manager to help coordinate the projects of our Network, Metrics, and Anti-Censorship teams, as well as our network interference observatory team known as OONI.

The ideal candidate has experience leading an open source project. Tor is developed and maintained collaboratively through the contributions of a diverse, global community. We work hard to choose communications tools that encourage participation, where every contributor is heard and respected. The person in this job must be a team player with excellent communication skills.

Our Network Projects PM understands that inter-team collaboration makes each team stronger, and will focus on helping teams work together effectively. This person will be responsible for ensuring a productive, healthy work environment so all team members are able to contribute effectively and to the best of their abilities. All teams are distributed globally across multiple time zones, so the ability to organize and communicate via chats, email, etc., is crucial. This person will also be the link between the teams, volunteers, and sponsors (funders), and thus must have strong organizational skills and the ability to communicate in writing to diverse audiences.

You will be helping the teams roadmap, identify projects for grant proposals, manage project execution, and write progress reports to our sponsors. You are an experienced professional who is capable of building processes and best practices for the teams, regardless of the tools being used.

This position will work closely with other team leads and project managers. This position reports directly to the Executive Director.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide advice to teams where needed and point them in the right direction; help them understand what is expected of them
  • Coordinate the transfer of information to and between the teams, sponsors, and greater Tor community
  • Organize team meetings, help your teams plan their roadmaps, and show the teams how to improve their processes
  • Work with the Tor Project’s Fundraising Director and Grant Writer on grant proposals by providing them with your teams’ ideas for projects and the personnel needed for execution
  • Manage risks and issues that might occur while executing a project
  • Manage execution of roadmap and monitor the progress of your teams’ projects

Qualifications:

  • Solid knowledge of internet technologies and security tools
  • Super organized
  • Know-how to build great processes no matter what tools teams are using
  • Great facilitator
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience managing people
  • Knowledge of and experience with software development life-cycle process
  • Experience with Free and Open Source Software culture
  • Comfortable with transparency
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Prior experience working on U.S. government grants and contracts a plus!
  • Willingness to travel to internationally at least twice a year

The Tor Project's workforce is smart and committed. Experience working with open source communities and/or a dedication to Internet freedom are added pluses. The Tor Project currently has a paid and contract staff of around 35 developers and operational support staff, plus many thousands of volunteers who contribute to our work. The ideal candidate will be energetic, unflappable and flexible, and will thrive in a highly-technical collaborative environment.

This is a full-time, hands-on position, which can be done remotely or in our office in Seattle, WA. Flexible salary, depending on experience. The Tor Project has a competitive benefits package, including a generous PTO policy; 14 paid holidays per year (including the week between Christmas and New Year's, when the office is closed); health, vision, dental, disability, and life insurance paid in full for employee; flexible work schedule; and occasional travel opportunities.

To apply, send a cover letter and your resume to hr at torproject dot org with the subject "Project Manager - Network." Tell us why you think you're the right person for this job and why you want to work at Tor Project. No phone calls please!

The Tor Project, Inc., is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer.

items.title: Hands on Chief Technology Officer VP Of Engineering
items.content:
Hands on Chief Technology Officer VP Of Engineering


Natural Health Sherpa


Excited to take on the challenge of strategically leading our tech team from the comfort of your home?
Eager to join a team of high-performing, yet humble A-players that simply get things done?
Excited to be a part a rapidly growing $250 billion+ industry while measurable improving peoples lives?
If so, and youre a seasoned, marketing-oriented, strategic-thinking technology leader with lots of hands on full-stack experience, has built and led efficient development teams and has an incessant drive towards excellence, an unquenchable curiosity and a get-it-done now mentality, wed love to talk.
Weve posted this both as a CTO and VP of Engineering role as both equally describe the actual opportunity and the day-to-day authority and responsibilities. To be 100% clear, this involves both heavy hands-on coding as well as strategically building and managing our tech team.
Were really looking for a seasoned engineering leader who has made lots of mistakes, has learned from that and mastered the art of technical discipline and smart decision making.
Who We Are:
We're an 8-figure direct response company that's been profitable since day 1 of our founding in 2010. Were in the process of re-branding our company to Metabolic Living. As part of this, were launching a branded e-commerce website that more accurately reflects our full suite of products weve developed.
And to help lead us into our next stage of growth, were hiring a hands-on, strategic-thinking CTO to continue building out our small, but highly efficient tech team. We have a number of exciting projects we need a full-time CTO to lead development efforts on:
* Were porting our outdated website at www.naturalhealthsherpa.com to our modernized content and commerce platform were building at www.metabolicliving.com on Shopify.
* Were strategically integrating our in-house direct response platform that weve built over the past 8 years with Shopify so we can leverage the best of elements of each platform
* An end-to-end assessment of tools weve built internally to determine what should be migrated to SaaS and what we should continue to develop/maintain
* Developing strategy to extend our success into the mobile app world; as up until now, weve been 100 web-focused with no app, but we have a huge opportunity with our own app
* Strategically guide the companys overall tech decisions as we continue on our path towards building out a billion-dollar lifestyle brand that penetrates into the offline retail channel


We're riding the $250+ billion annual tidal wave of demand for natural health products. And were positioning our new brand to be right on top of that wave. It is an extremely exciting time for us now.
Our nutrition courses and exercise programs are designed to deliver the most results in the least time. For example, our exercise videos deliver the same or better benefits in just 15 minutes, 3 times a week than do traditional exercise programs that require 60 minutes, 5 times a week. Yes, really.
You can see an example of one of our exercise products at http://www.metabolicrenewal.com as our e-commerce happens on product-specific websites for now. All e-commerce will happen on http://www.metabolicliving.com as part of the re-branding.
We also formulate state-of-the-art nutritional supplements and functional foods that fuel your metabolism to generate the energy you need to consistently perform at your peak. For example, instead of taking weeks to notice a difference, it takes just days to feel better.
We practice what we preach: our company is designed so everyone both enjoys their work challenges while having plenty of time to do what they love to do the most in their life. We recruit only high-performing, humble people who produce in fast cycles, hold themselves accountable and have fun.

Benefits

What You'll Enjoy from Us:
* Highly Competitive Salary This respects the fact that you are a needle in a haystack, a true high-performer that any company would die to have on their team.
* Performance Bonuses Additional cash compensation based both on company as well as individual performance, allowing you to participate in the companys upside success.
* Flexible Benefits We can customize your benefits to your specific situation, rather than forcing you to accept something that may not make sense for you.
* Work-from-Home Flexibility A fantastic lifestyle that allows you to work from home, have flexible hours when needed with ability to carve out time to do what you love.
* Curated Team Peace of mind knowing we only recruit high-performing, humble people and that youll be surrounded by a supportive, high-energy team that respects you and your work.



If this sounds like a good fit, if youre excited to do something challenging and meaningful that preserves your ability to enjoy life to the fullest, then please apply ASAP as we cant wait to meet you!

See more jobs at Natural Health Sherpa

items.title: Program Manager
items.content:
Program Manager


Citrusbyte


Company Overview


Citrusbyte is a team of craftspeople and experts who build amazing products and believe in cultivating a high degree of leadership in all of our people. We build medium and large scale applications that solve our customers' business-critical problems. 


Job Summary


We're looking for an experienced Program Manager to join the team at Citrusbyte. It is expected that you have lived the full product lifecycle, having bought multiple programs to completion.


In this role, you will lead a program staffed with craftspeople and experts, working directly with customers to build complex custom software applications. 


Responsibilities and Duties


As a Program Manager, you are responsible for overall product guidance, vision, prioritization, planning, and stakeholder communication. You've got to be a quick study and become a domain expert in the areas required for your products: You need to know the business opportunities, competitors, customer pain points and technical details about each product. The Program Manager is also a guide. Clients look to you to chart out the approach that will get them results within their time and budget. 


You will work closely with our designers who actually do the design & wireframing but you should be able to roll up your sleeves to create and make changes to wireframes yourself.



* Strategy: Collecting research, running project kickoffs, and defining business goals 

* Consulting: Guiding clients and project teams through the right steps to get a world-class product 

* Design: Converting ideas and goals into wireframes with a UX/UI designer, often developing the first set of sketches yourself or collaboratively 

* Engineering: Overseeing the delivery of each project milestone by managing/collaborating with the project team





We are looking for smart, driven & talented people who want to work in a consultative environment, help our clients have great projects and also contribute to the growth of a great company. Tell us more about you!


Qualifications and Skills


Prior to an interview, we will want to review wireframes and product positioning that you worked on ( alone or in a team ) and we are only proceeding with candidates who have strong product sensibilities. 


Benefits and Perks



* 100% REMOTE

* TEAM RETREAT - Once a year the entire Citrusbyte team gest together at an inspiring location to meet, work and play.

* HEALTHY BODY, HEALTHY MIND - HAPPY TEAM - We offer paid vacation and support healthy lifestyles through our physical fitness benefits program.

* HEALTHCARE & FINANCE - We have comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans, plus we have a 401k plan.


See more jobs at Citrusbyte

The Company

We are a fast-growing team and the founders have worked for some of the most prominent global hedge funds and scientific institutions.

Core requirements:
Previous experience with hiring preferred.
Technical background is a plus.

Ability to source candidates through online platforms and social media.

If you are passionate about connecting top talent people with amazing job opportunities, this is the role for you!

Benefits:
Successful candidate will have the opportunity to join a fast-growing, agile, and international team passionate about innovation and making a difference. We will offer guidance, mentorship and opportunities for turbo-charged professional development, as the first employee in our HR department.

items.title: Apple, Inc. | Cupertino -- Siri -- Apple’s Siri is looking for exceptional engineers, designers, and project managers well ...
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Apple, Inc. | Cupertino

-- Siri -- Apple’s Siri is looking for exceptional engineers, designers, and project managers well versed in machine learning, natural language, speech recognition, server automation, and/or mobile software development. Siri is used on countless iOS, tvOS and watchOS devices and handles over a billion requests per week.

If you’re passionate about Music, Natural Language Processing, Tool UI design, or one of a variety of our open positions, you’ll be right at home. Note that we have offices in Ottawa, Canada and Cambridge, UK too!

Apply online or send a resume to brittanyd@apple.com.

-- Security Engineering -- Apple’s Security Engineering and Architecture organization is looking for talented and driven engineers to build systems that protect our customers with leading privacy and security technologies. Successful candidates will be generalists capable of working anywhere in the stack from cloud-based infrastructure services to operating system components on device.

Do you start all tasks by asking yourself “how do I automate this”? Relish wading into unfamiliar code bases? Feel at home with multiple systems programming languages? Are you determined to ensure that devices are safely working on the owner’s behalf and protecting their digital lives?

Apply online or send a resume to nectar@apple.com.

items.title: Creative Strategist - Project Coordination for nevaly (m/f)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
At nevaly, it is our mission to forge memorable and authentic marketing campaigns. We work closely with our brand partners to understand their goals and identify social media influencers that match their needs. By developing and rolling out creative and unique marketing concepts we give those influencers the opportunity to endorse brands they love and at the same time raise awareness towards the brands of our clients.

We are looking for a talented Creative Strategist to guide RFP responses and influencer driven marketing activations. You will be a vital member in developing creative solutions and realising them into productions. You possess strong expertise across several areas such as content development, social media, and project management.

Success in this position will be measured by delivering high quality work and creative, “out-of-the-box” thinking, building nevaly’s creative portfolio and staying current on the latest social platforms, trends and industry practices in order to deliver actionable recommendations.


Your Role:

-Contribute towards brainstorming sessions designed toward specific outputs and client solutions

-Serve as the go-to project manager on complex productions and occasionally assist team members on their own individual projects

-Develop strategies and tactics that tie together multiple earned/owned/paid media channels with the client’s objectives

-Partner with team members to flawlessly execute client deliverables, and reports

-Demonstrate strong social media and influencer marketing understanding and the ability to effectively communicate ideas and proposals to internal team members, as well as to clients

-Be an active leader with a POV on industry, pop culture, and digital/social trends; develop internal presentations on new insights, innovations, and trend forecasting


Your Profile:

-2-3 years of experience in a creative agency, media or game company, or production house

-Highly organised with a structured approach to handling people and projects

-Strong presentation and storytelling skills

-Ability to communicate and relate with clients, creative professionals, and influencers

-A strong collaborator with flexibility and ability to provide structure in ambiguous situations, operate independently, and manage up, down and across

-Capable of building client trust and enhancing Agency/Client relationship

-Detail-oriented, flexible, and willing to work in a fast-paced, demanding client-focused environment with set deadlines

-Experience managing video or content productions including management of logistics


What do we offer?

-You become a part of a unique and fun company culture (http://nevaly.com)

-You work with a highly motivated team of top performers and gaming enthusiasts

-You will receive an unlimited contract from the beginning and get the chance to be trained in one of the most popular areas in the marketing industry at the moment: influencer marketing!

-You get free fruits, coffee, soft drinks and cereal, enjoy numerous team and company events and have the opportunity to attend German classesYou work in the start-up centre of Berlin-Mitte, the European Silicon Valley


Interested? - Submit your CV and tell us what games you like to play.

items.title: Customer Happiness Executive, Weekends
items.content:
We're looking for a candidate to join our customer service team working a minimum of 16 hours over Saturday and Sunday, but with the opportunity to expand to more hours if required. The role is primarily home-based, but there will be some compulsory training based in Canary Wharf at the beginning of the role and at various times throughout your employment.

YourParkingSpace, recently named as one of the UK’s fastest growing companies by Leap 100, is looking for an enthusiastic and driven Customer Happiness Executive with a passion for the sharing economy to join our rapidly growing tech start-up company and drive our customer experience. We are aiming to transform the parking industry by providing a platform that enables motorists to find and book parking online. We’re fast-growing and looking for someone to join us in our Canary Wharf office to assist us in our constant growth.

As a Customer Happiness Executive, it is your responsibility to ensure that every customer leaves with a positive impression of YourParkingSpace.

Whether a customer has contacted us with a general query or a complaint you will need to be fast-acting, stay calm under pressure, and remain positive throughout the interaction to ensure an exceptional customer experience is provided.

It’s necessary to expect the unexpected as unanticipated issues occur, you will need to be a keen problem-solver in order to handle any difficult situations which may arise.

You will play a crucial role within the team so as a remote operator you will need to be highly motivated, driven and passionate about the role. As a start-up we are still growing and learning as a company, therefore it is important to have the confidence to notify us of any recurring issues so that we can work to resolve these on mass to provide a better experience for all users.

The Role

- Acting as the first point of contact for most customers
- Communicating with users and potential users to give advice and answer any queries, in addition to resolving any complaints, often through thorough investigation.
- Providing prompt responses, within set service level agreements, using our customer support software, Zendesk
- Driving sales by negotiating terms with users of the site
- Achieving monthly sales targets as part of a team effort

The Right Person

- Experience in a customer-facing role
- Able to communicate to an excellent standard both written and verbally
- Exceptional computer skills
- Keen attention to detail
- Focused with the ability to self-motivate

items.content:
Job Title: Business Development Manager
Location: Old Street, London
Salary: £24-30k (+ Generous Sales Bonus Scheme)

The Goat Agency are the leading Influencer Marketing Agency in the UK and are currently expanding globally. We are looking for talented Business Development Managers to join us.

This is an ideal role for a self starter with excellent sales experience and entrepreneurial flair! We have some impressive clients we already work with such as Apple Music, UEFA, Formula E and New Look. We also have a fantastic culture with a collaborative environment where everyone pitches in and has the chance to excel.

Your responsibilities will include:

* Creating and updating sales presentations
* Researching and making contact with potential new clients
* Generating business leads
* Pitching proposals to clients
* Closing deals of £50k+
* Assisting the team with the delivery of sales presentations and materials

Required experience:

* 3+ Years experience in a previous sales role (Essential)
* Proven track record of closing 5-6 figure contracts (Essential)
* Experience of pitching proposals to clients (Essential)
* High organisational skills with ability to prioritise a diverse workload and to keep track of deadlines
* Knowledge of Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint
* Adobe Creative Suite (Advantageous)

Company Culture and Benefits:

* Generous Sales Bonus Scheme
* Team lunches and Friday office drinks
* Performance based rewards
* Fun vibrant office environment

If you would like to apply for this role, please click “Apply Now”.

items.title: Account Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Account Manager

Venturist is an end-to-end Growth Advisory Consultancy for Tech Startups and Corporate Startup Ventures. We believe that every company’s route to growth is different and one size does not fit all. Unlike traditional agencies within marketing, advertising, recruitment and training, Venturist takes an independent and unbiased approach to helping your new venture grow. The bottom line: We're here to guarantee and improved ROI. We exist to improve the way new ventures budget and hire for growth.

Working within the Digital Marketing side of the business and alongside the Business Development lead, we’re looking for an Account Manager to manage new and existing clients.

Reporting to the CEO, you’ll be responsible for managing new and existing clients and ensuring they are delighted with our service.

Duties / Responsibilities:

You will be mainly responsible managing of exiting and new clients.

You will also be expected to assist with winning meetings with clients and attending them

You will be working closely with the marketing team on sales material, the deck and overall product.

You will be negotiating trial, test campaigns and closing deals

You will be required to manage the relationship with the client and share marketing reports with them, to ensure that they are more than happy with our service.

About you:

At least 2 years experience working within a digital agency working in business development or account management.

Contacts and potential leads would be an advantage, but not essential.

All the skills associated with a great sales person: Driven, competitive, Hungry to succeed.

Superb Communication skills and likability

Excellent written skills

Super entrepreneurial: You will most likely be from a more established agency, who sees the benefit in joining a smaller agency where you will get exposure more of the managerial aspects of running a company as well as the seniority benefits.

Adaptable: This is a startup and as such there is no straight line to success. We’re always adapting and improving our processes, fast. So we need you to be able to adapt fast with us.

A personality. We’re a small team and a tight family. We’d say that we are a fun group, who are very social and are very well connected. This new hire will get exposure to all of this.

Just some of the benefits of Joining Venturist
Awesome office environment: fun, energetic and always something new and exciting.

Huge career acceleration: An opportunity to jump ahead in the ladder. You will be joining a employee 8-9, so great opportunity to become a director at such an early age in your career.

Huge learning potential and training. You be exposed to the daily activities of the senior management team and working alongside them.

Equity: You will be part of the early employee equity pool

Unlimited Holidays

Flexible working: You will be able to work from home for at least 1 day a week, and essentially manage your own schedule

Base salary with an excellent commission structure. Uncapped.

Cool offices. WeWork styled office, tea, coffee, fruit etc

Free Lunch Wednesdays, Drinks on Friday
